channel.title: Posts on Sunbits
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Sunbits

item.title: I broke my keyboard ):
item.description: and then I got a new one. It’s been a rollercoaster ride. Sunbits Project update So in Jan I wrote about Sunbits Project 2022 which was an experiment to work on my personal interests which refreshes every month for the sake of exploration and testing.

item.title: Sunbits Project 2022
item.description: Happy 2022! I had a recent bout of identity crisis sometime back in Dec 2021. It opened up a pandora’s box that took a lot of time and effort to grapple with. With the help of many kind individuals that I’m surrounded with (and very grateful for), I’ve managed to have a bit more understanding about what I am now and what I will work towards.

item.title: A bit: Dewey Decimal System
item.description: Have you ever looked at the spine of a library book and wondered how its call number was decided? Lucky for me, it was mentioned during work by a colleague of mine which led me into a small search on what it’s about.

item.title: Sunbits 1.1.0 Update
item.description: It’s been awhile. I’m back after an unplanned hiatus. When Sunbits was first created, I envisioned it to be a consistently updated living journal of my learnings and progress. If you look at my past posts.

item.title: Website Highlight: Spotify Fan Study
item.description: I came across Spotify’s Fan Study the other day - it shared a set of data-driven insights about the behaviours of Spotify Users and how artists can act upon them. I found it interesting and thought I’d share a short reflection piece about this website.

item.title: Book Review: Don't Make Me Think, Revisited
item.description: If I had to describe DMMT in three words, it would be: honest-to-goodness.
